Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: Pure Gym and Fitness World’s estate can be divided into the following size categories as of December 31, 2019:

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsection Title: As of December 31, 2019 Total** **Total Fitness Size (in gross square feet)** **Pure Gyms** **World Gyms
Subsubsection Text: 20,000+ ............................................................................................................... 68 17 15,000–20,000 .................................................................................................... 128 39 12,000–15,000 .................................................................................................... 35 74 9,000–12,000 ...................................................................................................... 17 74 <9,000 ................................................................................................................. 15 37 Total ...................................................................................................................** 263 241 _Pure Gym_ Pure Gyms vary in size between approximately 5,000 square feet and 37,000 square feet (gross), with an average size of approximately 17,400 square feet (gross) as of December 31, 2019. Pure Gyms generally have the following key characteristics: - 24 hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year gym access, which allows Pure Gym’s members to adapt their use of the gym to fit their individual lifestyles; - a large number and wide range of high quality, award-winning gym equipment from leading manufacturers, including Matrix and Precor; - one or two dedicated studio fitness areas, including in many cases dedicated stationary cycling studios, which enable each Pure Gym to offer approximately 50–80 free classes per week; - Yanga sports water dispensing machines offered at over 100 Pure Gym sites; - clean and well-appointed shower and changing facilities as well as disabled access, disabled toilets and shower facilities; - two to four fully-automated PIN and RFID tag- or QR code-controlled entry portals for secure member access; - free Wi-Fi internet access, TVs and professional sound system; - internet-enabled kiosks that allow prospective members to sign up for memberships and receive immediate access to gyms “at the gym door”; - continuously recording CCTV security cameras, proactively managed and monitored by Pure Gym’s in-house team during non-peak hours; and - at least one member of staff, a personal trainer or a member of the cleaning or maintenance team, who is trained in first aid, present for the majority of the hours of operation as well as CCTV monitoring when gym sites are unmanned. Pure Gym tailors its format to local market conditions to offer the best possible member experience. As a result, in addition to the common features described above, certain gyms may have specific features, such as “ladies only” areas. Pure Gym’s gyms do not have cafes, saunas, steam rooms, spas or pools, which are typically used by a small percentage of gym members. These amenities result in higher operating and Initial Capital Investment costs, and lower the amount of high utilization gym floor space, which limits the number of members gyms can support. Pure Gym has successfully proven a new gym format, which it refers to as “small box format” or “SBF” gyms. These gyms are very similar to other Pure Gyms but are smaller in size, typically in the range of 6,000 to 9,000 square feet. The SBF gyms enable Pure Gym to grow into areas that would not otherwise support a larger 153 ----- sized gym. As of December 31, 2019, Pure Gym’s estate consisted of 15 SBF gyms, 14 of which were organic and one which was acquired. _Fitness World_ Fitness World gyms vary in size between approximately 8,000 square feet and 45,000 square feet (gross), with an average size of approximately 13,500 square feet (gross) as of December 31, 2019. Fitness World gyms generally have very similar characteristics to Pure Gyms with the following differences to highlight: - digital membership platform and dedicated apps to compete in fitness challenges, receive ondemand training programs, book personal training sessions and track fitness metrics; - products from its sports nutrition brand, Functional Nutrition, including ready-to-drink and powder supplementation products for sale in vending machines across its clubs; - receptionists present during the hours of operation at most fitness club locations; - in-house personal trainers and an accompanying Fitness Institute that trains over 400 personal trainers a year; - enhanced “digital cycling” programs; and - low-cost fitness clubs called “Urban Gyms” which remove staffed reception desks, shower facilities, and group classes that are unutilized by cost-conscious members. Going forward, the Fitness World model and the fundamental characteristics of Fitness World clubs will remain in place as the Combined Group will continue to invest in the existing estate.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Pure Gym_ Pure Gym equips its gyms with a broad range of high-quality fitness equipment primarily consisting of Matrix or Precor cardiovascular and resistance equipment such as treadmills, cross trainers, stationary bikes and fixed resistance weight machines. In addition, Pure Gym also equips its gyms with an extensive free weights section, as well as other specialized training equipment such as kettlebells, TRX bands, medicine balls, core vibration stands and foam rollers. The majority of gyms also have specialized stationary bikes for Pure Gym’s free cycling classes. On average, large box format Pure Gyms have 101 pieces of free weight equipment, 58 pieces of cardio equipment and 106 pieces of functional and resistance equipment per gym. New types of fitness equipment are regularly added to ensure that Pure Gyms cater to the latest exercise and fitness trends. Pure Gym only selects equipment it believes to be high quality and designed for heavy and frequent use. Pure Gym believes that purchasing high quality equipment results in an improved member experience, reduces maintenance expenditure and ensures a longer equipment lifecycle. The specific fitness equipment installed in each Pure Gym is designed for each space based on management’s view of expected utilization allowing for demographic and other factors. Gym equipment is generally installed in phases. At opening, a base level of equipment is installed in each gym. This base level is then increased as membership begins to increase and actual usage patterns are observed and analysed. This is part of Pure Gym’s capital efficient fit-out strategy and ensures that it is able to tailor its product offering at the local level. Pure Gym is focused on maintaining the high quality of its gym equipment in order to provide its members with a compelling in-gym experience. As such, Pure Gym has a comprehensive fitness equipment and maintenance program with Matrix and Precor, who are contracted to repair any non-functioning piece of equipment within 48 hours. Pure Gym has a six to eight-year replacement cycle for cardio equipment over which time the equipment is depreciated on a straight line basis. See “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of _Financial Condition and Results of Operations of Pure Gym”. Fitness World_ Fitness World equips its gyms with a broad range of high-quality fitness equipment primarily consisting of Technogym cardiovascular and resistance equipment such as treadmills, cross trainers, stationary bikes and 154 ----- fixed resistance weight machines. Fitness World also offers practical settings on its stationary bikes and has optimized its machines to connect to software for Intelligent Cycling in partnership with one of its suppliers. In addition, Fitness World also equips its gyms with an extensive free weights section, as well as other specialized training equipment such as adjustable benches with dumbbells and squat racks built on a platform with individual mirrors for each squat rack. Standard Fitness World equipment includes the most commonly used plate-loaded Pure Strength machines. On average, Fitness World gyms have 75 pieces of free weight equipment, 40 pieces of cardio equipment and 50 pieces of functional and resistance equipment. Fitness World monitors the latest exercise and fitness trends as well as consumer dynamics in its gyms in order to make a decision regarding changes to its gym equipment. For example, in gyms where it seeks to attract a younger demographic, Fitness World has added in an expanded free weights area and tailored group classes. Data analysis is also used for optimization of a specific piece of equipment to its designated zone. Fitness World has a maintenance training program with a supplier that offers to educate Fitness World employees so they are able to service and repair the equipment within a target of six working days. Fitness World also has a maintenance program with Technogym, who is contracted to repair any non-functioning piece of equipment within five days if spare parts are in stock. Fitness World replaces malfunctioning cardio equipment older than six years and strength equipment older than eight years. Technogym equipment is depreciated on a straight line basis. See “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations _of Fitness World”._

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Pure Gym_ Personal training sessions are accessible at all Pure Gyms via independent fitness professionals who have attained Level 3 of the Register of Exercise Professionals qualification and, in most cases, are first-aid qualified. The additional fee for each personal training session on top of the membership fee clients pay for gym access is agreed with and paid directly to the personal trainer. There are typically between 10 and 15 personal trainers at each gym, depending on the number of members. All personal trainers at Pure Gym locations currently operate as independent contractors and are classified as rent-paying personal trainers (“Rent PTs”) or PT/FCs. Rent PTs are self-employed personal trainers who pay rent to use Pure Gym premises to train their clients. Rent is set contractually for each gym using the market rate for each locality and is paid on the 1[st] of each month. See “Risk Factors—Risks relating to our _business—Pure Gym may be adversely affected by a change in the historical employment status of personal trainers operating at its gyms”._ After extensive trials, Pure Gym recently rolled out a new operating model across all sites in which Pure Gym employs Fitness Coaches (“FCs”) for 12 hours per week under the terms of a standard employment contract. FCs may spend these 12 hours leading induction sessions for new members at Pure Gym, taking exercise classes, undertaking light cleaning, answering any questions members may have and generally having a visible presence on the gym floor. Separately, FCs will typically enter into a license agreement to be a rent-paying personal trainer. Where an individual performs both roles, they are referred to as “PT/FCs”. The PT/FC model replaces the historic Hours PT model, offers FCs clearer career development opportunity within Pure Gym and gives them certain benefits of being employed such as annual leave allowance, free gym membership and access to free employee assistance. At the same time, it provides Pure Gym with more control over its day-to-day operations during the 12 hours it employs FCs. This, in turn enables gym managers to operate their gyms more effectively. Based on the information currently available as well as high level business forecasts, Pure Gym does not expect the impact of the change in operating model set out above to cause a material adverse change to its Adjusted EBITDA. Pure Gym aims to attract fitness professionals who are passionate about fitness and who specialize in specific areas such as sports therapy, injury rehabilitation, nutrition and strength and conditioning. _Fitness World_ Personal training is offered in 184 out of 241 Fitness World clubs and continues to be a popular service among members. Revenues from personal training sessions have increased by 30% compared to the year ended December 31, 2018. Fitness World directly employs all of its personal trainers and currently has more than 400 personal trainers working at its facilities across Denmark and Switzerland. Personal training fees are set by Fitness 155 ----- World clubs and are paid through the club or via the designated Fitness World app. In Switzerland, Basefit is Qualitop-certified, which allows its members to receive reimbursement for a portion of their gym fees under their supplementary health insurance policies. Fitness World maintains the number of personal trainers required under this certification in its clubs in Switzerland. Fitness World prioritizes training for its personal trainers. In the year ended December 31, 2019, more than 150 students passed through its Personal Trainer Academy. In order to continue increasing the number of trainers at its fitness clubs, Fitness World acquired the Fitness Institute ApS, a sports and recreation education company, in 2018. Together, Fitness World’s Academy and Fitness Institute ApS have educated more than 440 personal trainers through their four month training program in 2019.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Pure Gym_ Pure Gym aims to offer a varied product offering, including at its SBF gyms. For example, Pure Gyms typically have one or two dedicated group exercise studios, including cycling studios outfitted with purpose built stationary bikes, per gym and generally offer approximately 50–80 free classes per week taught by qualified personal trainers. In addition to free classes, premium classes led by specialist instructors, such as Zumba, are typically offered for £2 per class outside of London and £4 per class in London. In some gyms, video/virtual classes are also offered that are accessible at any time, such as Les Mills video classes. Members are able to book places in studio classes using the Pure Gym app, the Pure Gym website or in-gym kiosks. Pure Gym believes that dedicated studio areas and a large fitness class offering attract a broader demographic of members, enhance member satisfaction and offer greater utilization of space during peak times. Pure Gyms also typically have functional training zones, which targets an area of fitness that has significantly grown in popularity recently. These zones typically include functional training rigs, TRX bands and battle ropes and are especially popular for personal training sessions. Pure Gym strongly believes these additional fitness services differentiate Pure Gym from many of its competitors in the value gym market. _Fitness World_ Fitness World offers personal training at 184 of its 241 fitness clubs and employs over 400 active personal trainers. Personal training fees are set by Fitness World clubs and are paid through the club or via the designated Fitness World personal training app. Fitness World also offers a wide range of group fitness classes ranging from cycling to yoga. Virtual group classes and supervision by trainers on the gym floor are available at Fitness World locations in Switzerland. Fitness World also offers a digital body composition tracker that enables members to track key metrics and their overall progress. In addition, Fitness World operates its own sports nutrition brand, Functional Nutrition, which features ready-to-drink and powder supplementation products. Fitness World has expanded distribution of the Functional Nutrition line at its own clubs, throughout Denmark and outside of Denmark in the Czech Republic.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Pure Gym_ Pure Gym’s customer value proposition is based on providing members with affordable, flexible and value for money access to a national network of high-quality and well-maintained gyms. As a result of its affordable price point, strong value for money offer and “everybody welcome” philosophy and marketing message, Pure Gym attracts a broad range of consumers, many of whom have not been members of a gym in the past due to high prices or the lack of flexibility and value in the offering. Pure Gym also attracts many members from traditional UK health club operators because of its more compelling product offer and lower price points. The following table sets forth the total number of Pure Gym members as of December 31 for the years listed below, except as otherwise indicated. **2010** **2011** **2012** **2013** **2014** **2015** **2016** **2017** **2018** **2019** Number of members[(1)] 45 119 183 284 412 622 818 927 1,012 1,135 (000s) (1) Excludes members from unconverted LA Fitness sites 156 ----- _Fitness World_ Similar to Pure Gym’s inclusive philosophy, Fitness World’s is committed to encouraging “healthy habits”, for people from all backgrounds. Fitness World enables people from all walks of life to live a healthier lifestyle by offering members affordable, flexible and value for money access to its high-quality and wellmaintained gyms across all of its geographic markets. As a result, Fitness World’s fitness clubs attract a broad range of consumers. The following table sets forth the total number of Fitness World members as of December 31 for the years listed below. **2010** **2011** **2012** **2013** **2014** **2015** **2016** **2017** **2018** **2019** Number of members (000s) 236 311 359 394 444 449 457 476 565 589

This broad appeal allows for significant market penetration and potential growth. As of December 31, 2019, 59% of Pure Gym’s customer base was male and 41% was female. Section Title: BUSINESS
BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Pure Gym_ Pure Gym’s Average Continuous Membership Tenure for the 38 longest-established Pure Gyms was 23 months as at December 31, 2019, which is clearly longer than a typical one-year gym contract. Many members who terminate their memberships later return (Source: Company information as of December 31, 2019). Of the members that left Pure Gym in 2017 and 2018, 33% later re-joined and 9% were members as at December 31, 2019. Pure Gym believes this long, continuous membership tenure and retention of former members is a testament to its strong customer proposition. 158 ----- The table below sets forth a breakdown of the percentage of members by band of continuous membership tenure for the 263 Pure Gyms as of December 31, 2019.
